ranked_diseases.explanation: Classic presentation with intellectual disability, autistic behavior, ADHD, global developmental delay, triangular face, short stature, microcephaly, and anteverted nares. Motor and speech delays are characteristic.
X-linked form presenting with similar features including intellectual disability, developmental delays, facial dysmorphism, and growth retardation.
Another subtype with overlapping features of intellectual disability, growth retardation, and characteristic facial features.
Features intellectual disability, microcephaly, short stature, and developmental delays. Facial features can include anteverted nares, though triangular face is less typical.
Characterized by short stature, triangular face, intellectual disability, and speech delays. Microcephaly is less common but can occur.
Features intellectual disability, autistic behaviors, speech delays, and microcephaly. Short stature and triangular face are less typical but can occur.
Includes intellectual disability, autistic behaviors, microcephaly, and growth retardation. Anteverted nares can be present in facial dysmorphism.
Features intellectual disability, ADHD, developmental delays, and short stature. Facial features differ but can include anteverted nares. Recurrent otitis media is common.
